definition: head/hair style/the top/end/beginning or end/a stub/remnant/chief/boss/side/aspect/first/leading/classifier for pigs or livestock/CL:個|个[ge4]
name/noun (part of speech)/place (e.g. among winners)/famous/classifier for people

sentences.english: China on Saturday meet Japan in a clash that will decide the Group toppers.
sentences.chinese: 明天中国将和日本比赛决定小组头名。

sentences.english: In Miami, tummy tucks were the No. 1 procedure being investigated.
sentences.chinese: 在迈阿密，紧腹手术是调查中的头名。

sentences.english: Top would be fine, but to be near the top would mean the run-in would present us with an opportunity.
sentences.chinese: 头名当然好，但紧追领头羊意味着我们还有机会。

sentences.english: The USA topped the group after an injury-time winner over Algeria.
sentences.chinese: 美国绝杀阿尔及利亚，获得了小组头名。

definition: (sports) to go out of bounds/to go over the line/to qualify for the next round of competition/(Tw) (fig.) to make the grade/to achieve success
total victory/to excel by far/name of a tank/slam
table of scores (in exams or sports league)
an upset (esp. in sports)/unexpected turn of events/to pull off a coup/a breakthrough

victory/success/to beat/to defeat/to surpass/victorious/superior to/to get the better of/better than/surpassing/superb (of vista)/beautiful (scenery)/wonderful (view)/(Taiwan pr. [sheng1]) able to bear/equal to (a task)
a sure catch/sth one is sure to obtain
to defeat decisively/to win decisively/great victory/triumph
